Communist Party of the United States of America Records

The Education Department is a vital component of the Party that functions at the national, district, and club level. At every level the Department is responsible for instructing membership on the foundations of communist ideology, informing members of key policy issues, and guiding members in carrying out Party initiatives. The work of the Education Department is closely tied with the teachings and curriculum of many of the schools that were affiliated with the CPUSA. As a result, many of the discussion guides from the National Education Department are likely duplicated in Subseries B: Schools. Records of the National Education Department contain discussion guides and new member course work, which are useful for understanding topics and themes important to Party education. A small amount of teaching resources and research materials are also included in this series. Of particular interest are scripts and image boards for a mail-order course on the "History of the American Negro," that the Party distributed in the early 1950s. Records from the New York State education department are largely comprised of Carol Pittman's files from her time as Director.
